intro: Spigelia multispica var. discolor, commonly known as the spotted spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in association with other woodland flora. The varietal name "discolor" refers to the variable coloration of its flowers and leaves.
